description:
a consolidated atlas of polyadenylation sites from 3' end sequencing.

A portal to the curated set of poly(A) sites that we inferred in the human, mouse and worm genomes, based on all 3’ end sequencing datasets that we could identify in the SRA nucleotide database as of June 2019.

Learn more about the techniques used for 3' end sequencing.

Samples contributing to our atlases.

Get details on any sample we used for building our atlases. You can also filter, either by organism or by protocol, or just try a search term.

Search for poly(A) sites in your gene/genomic region of interest.

In the 2P-Seq protocol, reverse transcription is accomplished by an anchored oligo(dT) primer.

The Atlas - our curated dataset of poly(A) sites - can be downloaded or explored in the UCSC genome browser.

If you use PolyASite in your work, please cite:.
